result.execSummary:
The defendant William T. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and stayed with huber and 1 day credit.

Defendant to pay for, attend and successfully complete programs as recommended by the agent.  AODA and follow through.

Defendant is to submit to random UA's for the first 12 months of probation.  After that, as per agent.

Defendant to pay costs of action and costs of probation.

Eligible for expungement (per 973.015) upon successful completion of probation.  Defendant to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding this procedure when the time comes.

(Per the Court's order as part of sentencing in this case, Defendant will forfeit the $2016 that was taken as evidence.  This is not a cost to be collected by probation.  It is simply noted for the JOC.)
Concurrent with: Probation for counts 1, 2 and 3 concurrent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William T. Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Lisa A. McDougal in court with Defendant William T. Clark. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty M. states parties have reached resolution, presents plea questionnaire. Atty Harper recites plea agreement. No objection by Atty M. 

Amend: 
Count 1: 961.41(3g)(e)
Count 2: 961.41(3g)(b)
Count 3: stands as charged. 

Def pleads guilty to counts 1, 2 & 3. Court's colloquy re. charges/max possible penalties. Further colloquy re. plea questionnaire/waiver of rights. Court finds factual basis to the charges. Court finds def is entering his pleas freely, voluntarily and intelligently and accepts pleas. Court finds def guilty on all three charges.

Sentencing:

Count 1: 20 days imposed and stayed on each count, consecutive to each other, 2 years probation,attend, pay for and successfully complete programs as recommended by agent, AODA assessment and follow through, random UA's for first 12 months, after that, as per agent, eligible for expungement upon successful completion. Costs of action and probation as condition of probation. 

Count 2: 20 days imposed and stayed on each count, consecutive to each other, 2 years probation, attend, pay for and successfully complete programs as recommended by agent, AODA assessment and follow through, random UA's for first 12 months, after that, as per agent, eligible for expungement upon successful completion. Costs of action and probation as condition of probation. 

Count 3: 20 days imposed and stayed on each count, consecutive to each other, 2 years probation, attend, pay for and successfully complete programs as recommended by agent, AODA assessment and follow through, random UA's for first 12 months, after that, as per agent, eligible for expungement upon successful completion. Costs of action and probation and as condition of probation.


Def will forfeit $2016 taken as evidence. One day credit in event of revocation, huber in event of revocation.

ADDRESS INFO for William T. Clark
Current: 425 Weir Blvd, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 08-01-2014)
Prior: 208 W. Madison Street, Spring Green, WI 53588
Status conference on August 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal.  Formal reading waived.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his right to prelim.  Atty. M states that def waives prelim time limits but reserves his right to have one at a later date.  DA notes that Judge Sharp had indicated at the bail hrg that he may recuse himself due to contact he had with the def's family several years ago.  Judge Sharp states that he does not recall specific contact with the def, rather only his family members, and, as such, does not feel he has a problem presiding in this case.  Counsel request next date as status.  Status conference scheduled for 08-06-2014 at 11:00 am.
